roleset.name: (cause to) lose moisture
roleset.note: DRY-V NOTES: Frame added by Arrick (from dry.02-v)
DRYING-N NOTES: Corresponds with dry.02. Framed by anwen april 2011 (from drying.01-n)

roles.note: arg2 added for the adjective, and can potentially occur with the verb as well, although rarely (and I doubt it's come up before, or there would be an arg for it). (from dry.02-j)

example.name: no subject
example.text: Perhaps people fleeing the fighting found it *EXP* difficult * to lug sacks of rice with them, so instead they ground the rice to a pulp and flattened it into strips,[ which]-9 [*T*]-9 were then boiled and dried [*]-9.

example.name: cause, no object
example.text: From the stripping of the ramie bark *0* *T* to get fibers, through * framing, sun-drying and dying, * to weaving, tailoring and embroidering, every step in the process of * making cloth is women's work.

example.name: both arguments
example.text: He found that the strong wind and bright sunshine were good for * drying noodles.
example.arg: * - the strong wind and bright sunshine

example.name: Both args
example.text: Bartholomew's drying of the sheets was interrupted by a rain storm.

roleset.name: lacking adornment, emotion, warmth
roleset.note: DRY-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WordNet. (from dry.04-j)

example.name: arg1
example.text: If you remember George Burns and Gracie Allen, George's humor was dry.

example.name: arg1
example.text: The reading was a little dry but filled with authority.

roleset.name: containing low residual sugar (as of wine)
roleset.note: DRY-J NOTES: Added by Julia. (from dry.05-j)

example.name: arg1
example.text: However, depending on the level of acids (and to a lesser extent alcohol and/or tannins), our perception of whether a wine is dry or sweet may differ somewhat from its dry/sweet designation.

roleset.name: containing much strong liquor
roleset.note: DRY-J NOTES: Added by Julia. (from dry.06-j)

example.name: words to live by?
example.text: Make sure her martini is extra dry, and that your apron is tied straight.

roleset.name: abstaining from/prohibiting alcohol
roleset.note: DRY-J NOTES: Added by Julia. (from dry.07-j)

example.name: arg1
example.text: he's been dry for ten years.

example.name: arg1
example.text: Get yer liquor before you come, because this county is dry.

roleset.name: lacking moisture
roleset.note: DRY-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-4,5, dry-v.02. (from dry.02-j)

roles.note: arg2 added for the adjective, and can potentially occur with the verb as well, although rarely (and I doubt it's come up before, or there would be an arg for it).

example.name: args 1, 2
example.text: A 'dry cough' is dry of mucus.

example.name: Adjectival rel: dry; arg1
example.text: I noticed i was getting these permanent forehead lines and that my face was a bit dry .

example.name: intransitive
example.text: He wo n't for long , because his old state sources of rye and potatoes are drying up .
example.arg: his old state sources of rye and potatoes

example.name: transitive
example.text: But in either case , the report says [0] [*T*-2], China 's balance of payments would rapidly dry up foreign reserves , which [*T*-1] are used [*-3] [*] to finance the imbalance .
example.arg: foreign reserves , which [*T*-1] are used [*-3][*]to finance the imbalance

roleset.name: (cause to) become less moist
roleset.note: DRY_OUT-V NOTES: Frame added by Arrick (from dry.03-v)

example.name: no subject
example.text: and that-1 needs *-1 to dry out

example.name: Within CXN
example.text: My skin was getting scaly , my eyes burning and my feet were so dry they begin to develop calluses and crack .
example.arg: [so] , [they begin to develop calluses and crack]
